summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 between U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) personnel regarding a request for Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) staff work schedules and related records for specific staff members (Thomas, Noel, and another) covering July and August 2019. The context suggests this is part of an OIG investigation into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: OIG Request for MCC Staff Records
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General requests specific MCC staff work schedules, prisoner remand forms, commissary reports, population rosters, running boards, and SHU post order review sheets for dates in July and August 2019.

events.title: Email Chain on Document Status
events.description: Email correspondence updates the status of various requested documents related to MCC staff and inmate monitoring, indicating some have been turned over and others are still being located.

keyFacts: The Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating circumstances at the MCC in September 2019, specifically requesting staff work schedules and inmate monitoring records from July and August 2019.

The investigation sought records for specific staff members Thomas and Noel, including their 'Daily Assignment Roster', 'Signed SHU Post Order Review Sheets', and distinction between 'Correction Service Staff' and 'non-custody Service staff' roles.
The request explicitly mentions '292 forms for Epstein', indicating a focus on documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.
The email chain shows a back-and-forth over several days (September 5-17, 2019) as OIG agents follow up on their document requests, highlighting the investigative process.

References to 'SHU Post Order Review Sheets' and 'Population Monitoring Census/Roster' suggest the investigation was examining cell check procedures and overall inmate monitoring protocols at the MCC.
